definition: threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: In order to avoid traffic congestion, evening time tickets will also be provided.
sentences.chinese: 此外，为避免白天交通高峰，还设计了夜场票。

sentences.english: There's no chance of a ticket for Saturday's evening show.
sentences.chinese: 没有可能买到星期六夜场的票了。

sentences.english: Prices are usually lower in the daytime than at night.
sentences.chinese: 白天场的电影价格往往比夜场的要低得多。

sentences.english: Are we going to the matinee or the evening performance?
sentences.chinese: 我们去看日场还是夜场？

sentences.english: And waiting also all day for the night session, that is nerve-wracking on top of it.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须为了夜场等一整天，这更是让人神经紧绷。

sentences.english: I had to get used to playing at night again.
sentences.chinese: 我必须再次习惯夜场比赛。

sentences.english: The princess attended the opening night of the opera .
sentences.chinese: 公主观看了那歌剧首次演出的夜场。

sentences.english: This offer is applicable to the regular price of matinee and night shows.
sentences.chinese: 此优惠只适用于日场及夜场之正价戏票。

definition: to spend time in a bar (alcohol, Internet etc)/to go clubbing
karaoke hall/singing hall (venue for concerts of popular songs)
abbr. for 北京工人體育場|北京工人体育场[Bei3 jing1 Gong1 ren2 Ti3 yu4 chang3], Workers Stadium
disco/night club/abbr. for 迪斯科廳|迪斯科厅
